results.title: I am safe
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Joyce Evans and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2005, the Australian Federal Government introduced new laws to address to potential and perceived threat of terrorism. Dubbed the ‘anti-terrorism’ or sedition law, the outcome of the reforms would enable someone to be detained on suspicion of a terrorist act for up to seven days, with significantly less rights than afforded a suspect of any other criminal act. The laws have given Joyce Evans pause for consideration about whether these measures were really going to make Australia safe in the long run, or leave Australia open to despotic rule in the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Joyce Evans and ACMI

results.title: The Port mob
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Edwin Whiting and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edwin Whiting speaks fondly of his time when he and his mates had the run of Port Melbourne in the 1930s. They spent most of their spare time together, but World War II changed everything.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Edwin Whiting and ACMI

results.title: Why plant millions of trees
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Alfred Zerfas and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.

results.title: Family treasures
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Penny Morison and ACMI
results.brief_description: Penny Morison provides a sensorial experience as she recalls her many holidays spent at the family holiday home in Aireys Inlet, on the south-west coast of Victoria. Run by her aunt, the holiday home has provided countless Summer memories for Penny as she was growing up and for future generations.

results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Melanie Steptoe and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melanie Steptoe recounts the story of T Pyxidis, a star. Sensing the wonders of the universe, T Pyxidis takes a bold step and initiates a journey to the Earth.

results.title: Expectations
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jimmy Pasakos and ACMI
results.brief_description: In this initimate use of the form of Digital Storytelling, Jim Pasakos puts together this story for his child. Using second person narrative, Pasakos tells of the decision to have a baby and the processes leading up to the birth. This serves as a very personal account of childbirth and a cherished family record.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jimmy Pasakos and ACMI

results.title: Roma
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Barbara Lemon and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Lemon pays tribute to her grandmother; cheeky, fiesty, caring and resilient. From growing up in Warrigal during the war to the birth of her great grandchildren, Roma has seen a lot in her 102 years and is more than happy to share her stories with her family.

results.title: Taking a chance on love
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Susan Dirgham and ACMI
results.brief_description: Many years ago, Susan Dirgham’s parents took a chance on love, in spite of their differences. Her parent’s leap of faith has inspired Susan Dirgham to throw herself into new experiences and follow her heart, which has taken her to some very unusual places. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: People in red hats
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jane Curtis and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Curtis reflects on how she spent her childhood sitting in the loungeroom of her grandparents home. As her family spoke in a language she didn’t understand, Curtis was transfixed by the painting that hung on her grandparent’s wall. Only as an adult would she discover the mysteries that painting held. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jane Curtis and ACMI
results.description: Jane Curtis reflects on how she spent her childhood sitting in the loungeroom of her grandparents home.
